value.name: Why did you march? One year since the murder of George Floyd
value.description: The police murder of George Floyd one year ago today touched off the largest wave of protests in American history. Nearly every day, thousands poured out of quarantine and into the streets of Ann Arbor and Southeast Michigan at a time when vaccines were a distant dream.

value.name: ‘A reenvisioning of policing in our community.’ Takeaways from Ann Arbor forum
value.description: I just want respect and I haven’t seen it,” the Ann Arbor police oversight commissioner told a crowd of over 60 people at a forum Tuesday night, May 25, in Liberty Plaza. The commission hosted a discussion on police reform and the future of public safety on the anniversary of George Floyd’s murder by Minneapolis police.
